item.question: Emily is going to get her vision tested because she can't see the board at school. What does vision probably mean?
item.answer: what color eyes a person has

item.question: Alex was excited by the tremendous monster trucks at the show. They were bigger than he had ever seen. What does tremendous probably mean?
item.definition: Definition: Very great in amount, scale, or intensity.

item.question: If you gaze long enough at that picture of an old woman, she will seem to turn into a young woman. What does gaze probably mean?
item.definition: Definition: Look steadily and intently, especially in admiration, surprise, or thought.

item.question: With talent like that, he should go far as a musician. I've never heard such amazing playing. What does talent probably mean?
I can hardly express the joy I felt at seeing her again. What does joy probably mean?
item.definition: Definition: A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.

item.question: Janelle had a sore calf after the race. She rubbed her leg from the knee to the ankle. What does CALF probably mean?
item.definition: Definition: The part of the back of your leg between your knee and your ankle.

item.question: The permit is withdrawn if the clearance is not obtained within three years.What does WITHDRAWN probably mean?
item.definition: Definition: To remove or take away (something) from a particular place or position.

item.question: A great relationship is found when two people complement, not complete, each other. What does COMPLEMENT probably mean?

answer.correct: Added to embellish or make perfect

item.answer: Added to embellish or make perfect
item.definition: Definition: A thing that contributes extra features to something else in such a way as to improve or emphasize its quality.

item.question: The strange bird let out a high-pitched sound that is idiosyncratic to its species. What does IDIOSYNCRATIC probably mean?
item.definition: Definition: An idiosyncrasy is an unusual feature of a person. It can also mean an odd habit. The term is often used to express eccentricity or peculiarity. A synonym may be "quirk".

item.question: Their magenta leaves swayed from the gentle zephyr that crossed their path. What does ZEPHYR probably mean?
